website_summaries.verdict: This paper can not only repel water, but also survive grease, mud, and many chemicals.
pros: Paper will hold up if posted outside for a long time
Prints like normal paper in a laser printer
Resists tears, but can be cut easily if needed
Ink doesn't smear, even if you submerge it in water
cons: The paper can sometimes jam in the printer or crinkle in the printing process
More expensive than some other brands

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Map Paper
customer_reviews.text: Perfect print quality. I use this paper to print detailed topo maps for backcountry adventures. The result (assuming you use a color laser printer) is a high quality, waterproof, non-smearing map that I can write on. The paper doesn’t fold as neatly as wood pulp paper, but it is super tough and rip-proof—you can stuff it anywhere and it comes out fine. I highly recommend if you want custom maps for adventures of any sort.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Beel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: We use this paper at work for taking notes in corn test plots. Taking notes in the morning when there is dew on the leaves can be particularly difficult because paper gets soggy and some water proof papers smudge as the leaves rub on them. With this paper there are no worries as long as you use the correct type of pen. The ones we like to use are the UNIball Power Tank RT. I did a test one time and was able to write on this paper while running it under the sink with no smudges using the aforementioned pen.
customer_reviews.author: Brad T. Dobie

customer_reviews.title: Works will in my black and white laser printer
customer_reviews.text: It has a mat surface, my laser printer prints well on it, and it is tough and thick enough to hold up to some abuse. I print maps and keep them in my cargo pants pocket and they survive a season of hunting, skiing and snowshoeing and are almost like new a year later except where the ink rubs off at the creases. I have used other brands and this seems as good as the others but less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: as an escape room, we were constanly replacing paper clues, or having to laminate them, this has solved our problems in many ways! This 'paper' is very hard to damage/tear, since switching to this, we have stopped laminating(unless we need something thicker), and have only replaced a clue 1 time, and that is only because someone used a pen and wrote on it! Highly recommend for highly handled projects, or any project that could get wet!
customer_reviews.author: The Cryptic Room

customer_reviews.title: Dealer plate paper
customer_reviews.text: I work at a used car dealer and my bro my boss forgot to order expensive paper so I ordered this exactly the same thing at a fraction of the price we used it with a laser printer just wait a couple of minutes let it dry and perfect you can wet it and it’s not gonna get messed up at all it’s kind of like plastic paper
customer_reviews.author: Mary Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paper to make a waterproof journal to take on a hiking trip. It was difficult to fold, impossible to cut with a paper cutter, and very stiff so it doesn't make for a pleasing feel for a journal. I'm sure it's good for other prposes but sadly, not mine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: This "paper" is amazing. Used it to print (laser printer only) score sheets for an outdoor competition. The form was printed in color (laser printer only) on the 4 MIL and given to the competitors for the 2 days multi-weather competition. Scores were written on the form in Black Sharpie. The form was then folded and shoved into pockets, packs, under hats, carried, and generally mistreated from competition station to station. We had zero tears, holes, ink runs, or unreadable issues. Regular pens were banned after we found that they do not stay on the "paper" Worked so well we purchased a bigger pack for "extra".
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Just As Tough As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is terrific. You really can't tear it with your fingers, it doesn't abrade, but it cuts easily enough with scissors or Xacto knife. I have no reason to think it isn't also just as water-proof as they say. I own a boutique mattress store, and make custom 100% latex mattresses; every one needs a so-called "Law Label" (the "Not To Be Removed By Law Except by the Consumer" label). This is a perfect material, meeting the tough durability requirements of the law, yet printing easily in any laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Great, permanent solution for laser printed material.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! Absolutely WILL NOT TEAR. Printed business cards with it on my HP Laser jet and the colors are vivid and sharp. Soaked it in soapy water, dried it and noticed ZERO degradation. I punched a hole in one corner with a hole punch and attached it to a cheap umbrella as a thank you gift for customers, knowing that my name and info would be always available for them. This would be ideal for menus or lab instruction sheets.
customer_reviews.author: ggskip

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and super strong
customer_reviews.text: We used this paper to print our hunting tags in Montana this year. It was thin and foldef up easily to put into my wallet to carry and not take up a bunch of room. Ran under water and the ink did not run. I tried to tear it and I could not tear it whatsoever. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Bowslayer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Smeared immediately! Touched it with wet fingers an hour later and it smeared again! Waste of money and time! Edited review: above review was using an ink jet printer. I used a laser printer today and the paper is indeed waterproof and the ink did not smear.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Tough paper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paper to make -waterproof maps -erasable notebooks -tough reference pages I've successfully made all of these. A year later and the sheets are doing great. I just ordered another package.
customer_reviews.author: rtrudel

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: See this is as a type of paper when you get a temporary tag for your car that can take all weather beat ups. a similar type of material and surely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Mutellip

customer_reviews.title: Works great for trail maps!
customer_reviews.text: Use this for backpacking maps. Takes a print from a xerox-type printer that is sharp and clean. Can be folded but the creases are permanent. The second fold takes a bit more effort but works. I folded in half, then in thirds to fit a shirt pocket. We got soaked one day, was glad to have a map that wouldn't disintegrate.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: It Has Specific Use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted laser printer paper for my calligraphy class. This paper is slick and glossy and maybe is meant for printing photos but definitely not for handwork with a pen or brush,
customer_reviews.author: sparkleplenty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing paper
customer_reviews.text: This paper has got to be the most amazing paper I have ever used. It is fun to see if people can tear, it is totally tear proof. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: takes ink very well and does not smear / will order again
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Nast

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a Gift
customer_reviews.text: Used for printing hunting/fishing licenes purchased on line. Carried in wallet and tags put on game in the field. Regular paper does not stand up.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE it !!! I’m using it for my Go Bag making Copies of important papers. Especially since it’s hurricane season.
customer_reviews.author: JORDAN GORMAN

customer_reviews.title: This paper is amazing and I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This paper is amazing and I highly recommend it. The paper cannot be torn and is difficult to puncture, and it's also weatherproof. I used these for lost cat signs and when I found my mom's cat months after he was lost these signs still looked like new.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Unique “Paper”
customer_reviews.text: I love that this waterproof paper is so durable, smooth, and versatile. I’m very glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Blazin’

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to make race bibs and it worked out perfect. I used a hole punch for the holes for the safety pins. Everyone loved the bibs! Very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: not satisfied with print quality
customer_reviews.text: not satisfied print quality wad not good on paper. .could have been my printer. I have 3170cdw brother printer
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: A Kitchen or Vehicle Maintenance MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for recipes and automotive work instructions. They work well in my Canon lazerjet printer. The ink NEVER smudges, they are extremely water resistant. Colors are true to life when printed.
customer_reviews.author: 7SFCW4

customer_reviews.title: True waterproof paper
customer_reviews.text: Great product will buy again. Will not fall apart even going through a washing. Both the paper and print stay on well.
customer_reviews.author: First time user

customer_reviews.title: Great but pricy product if you need a waterproof page
customer_reviews.text: Great but pricy product if you need a waterproof page. Prints on a color laser very nicely, even on both sides. Holds up well as quick and simple outdoor signage for special events.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, if you need an almost indestructible paper ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff, if you need an almost indestructible paper substitute. Worked fine in my laser printer when printing two-sided. From now on, I'll be keeping some on hand. I use it for printed materials to be used on my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Headline News!
customer_reviews.text: Just exactly why I was looking for. I had been searching for white mylar sheets but now I know they are called synthetic papaer.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. However
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. However, the sheets will heat up and begin to stick together if you print over 50 consecutive pages on a laser jet printer. High volume printing also leads to static.
customer_reviews.author: meheimer

customer_reviews.title: Poly paper does good
customer_reviews.text: Is a quality product. Will work well in other project. Is not heavy enough for planned job. Works in printer well. Is equal to 20 # paper.
customer_reviews.author: JHr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for spaces that will get wet or damp repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as part of an experimental product. Wound up using to study for my exams while showering. Easily takes laser printing. I'm also using a 6B pencil for very easy writing. Punching holes in the paper does not reduce waterproof viability. Takes colored pencils equally well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren E. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Tough stuff
customer_reviews.text: Tough to fold but great for passport copies when traveling light.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: perfect for printing topo maps
customer_reviews.text: This paper is perfect for printing USGS topographic maps for outdoor use. Colors are vibrant (more so than on standard laser printer paper), and the paper is durable and truly waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Philip E. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: paper worked like a charm to bring up t-shirt bibs for an organized bike ride. Held up in the 25mph winds were rode through. Papers arrived quickly. Had no problem using in my laser printer, but putting in the side sheet feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Bottle Fan

customer_reviews.title: ... then rubbed water on it and the "paper" is fine and nothing smudged or ran
customer_reviews.text: Laserprinted on it and it then rubbed water on it and the "paper" is fine and nothing smudged or ran. I tried bunching it and ripping it and it was fine. I was still able to hole punch it like regular paper. It's a whole new world minus the laminator. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Violet Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Prints well in my laser printer. Durable. Tearproof and waterproof. Recommend over other polyester paper.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: This "paper" is amazing. Used it to print (laser printer only) score sheets for an outdoor competition. The form was printed in color (laser printer only) on the 4 MIL and given to the competitors for the 2 days multi-weather competition. Scores were written on the form in Black Sharpie. The form was then folded and shoved into pockets, packs, under hats, carried, and generally mistreated from competition station to station. We had zero tears, holes, ink runs, or unreadable issues. Regular pens were banned after we found that they do not stay on the "paper" Worked so well we purchased a bigger pack for "extra".
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for exterior signs or documents that you do not want to have ruined in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for things that get moist. This paper is waterproof and tear proof. GREAT STUFF
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts fine with my foiling shears and prints on my laser ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it for stain glass patterns. No pattern melt and you can peel then off and use again. Cuts fine with my foiling shears and prints on my laser printer perfect. What a time saver
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cress

customer_reviews.title: works great! I will be buying more in the future ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my SCUBA diving logs. works great! I will be buying more in the future after I fill these pages up with dives!
customer_reviews.author: jnunniv

customer_reviews.title: It works GREAT! I can just rinse off the paper if ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought TerraSlate paper so I could print recipes and keep them in the kitchen without the paper getting ruined every time I spill something. It works GREAT! I can just rinse off the paper if I get something on it. Now I can keep all of my favorite recipes close to me without the bulky cookbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M Huszcza

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Just what I needed for preserving printed products.
customer_reviews.author: Betty R.

customer_reviews.title: Tough stuff!
customer_reviews.text: this is the best paper I have ever seen! Impossible to tear. makes a great resume paper for a construction worker!
customer_reviews.author: LUVBOD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We use this paper for survey targets for 3D scanning. Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: phil hogan

customer_reviews.title: usable but ink runs alittle when you print something
customer_reviews.text: usable but ink runs alittle when you print something out
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D.

customer_reviews.title: Yet on the test page that was sent the image is fine if folded
customer_reviews.text: When printing using a laser printer the image will crack if the paper gets folded at all. Yet on the test page that was sent the image is fine if folded, crinkled or put through the tests. I have tried multiple Laser printers to try and alleviate this issue with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Terranova

customer_reviews.title: I could be the fault of my printer, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I could be the fault of my printer, but the paper comes out of the laser printer all warped as if it almost melted, so I can't really use it. It would be all right in an ink jet, but then the ink would wash off in the rain which defeats the purpose of waterproof paper.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this paper! Would recommend to anyone! And service was fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria A. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Very thin, tends to curl after running thru Laser ...
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, tends to curl after running thru Laser Printer. The paper does print well and the waterproof aspect does work well with both printed and written mediums. I would upgrade to a thicker paper.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Poor ink adhesion.  Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Ink does not adhere well. Paper needs a surface treatment to lower surface energy
customer_reviews.author: Frozen Northlander

customer_reviews.title: Soak it before you use it and the smearing will convince you not to count on it.
customer_reviews.text: After printing the ink was wet and would smear. I printed 6 sheets and let them dry over night. I ran them underwater and they smeared badly and kept smearing as long as they were wet. I then printed with National Geographic Adventure paper I have used many times. As always it came out the the printer dry and not matter how long keep it in the water it never smears. Yes, it costs a lot more but I clearly cannot rely on the TerraSlate paper. I now have a lot of tear proof but not water proof paper that I really have no use for.
customer_reviews.author: Fairbanks, Ak

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this kind of paper would live up to its waterproof description when used for signage outdoors. I tried a couple of No Parking signs to tape to a garage door to test the paper out. After a week that included high winds, lots of hard rain and exposure to the southwest sun, The sign looks like I just printed it. No runs or streaks of any kind. Time will tell how it stands up to sunlight. I will be getting more, only the 7 mil weight as 4 mil is like the 20# standard paper.
customer_reviews.author: Jack DTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: TerraSlate Copy Paper Waterproof Laser Printer, Rain Weatherproof, 4 MIL, 8.5x11-inch, 25 Sheets
feature_bullets: WATERPROOF PAPER: rip proof and weather-resistant paper. Can hold up in any environmental condition
WEATHERPROOF: Tough enough to hold up to harsh weather, chemicals, mud, grease, sweat and excessive handling
EXCELLENT IMAGE QUALITY. This tough material has incredible tear strength and is perfect for applications that need to last
RECYCLABLE: Completely recyclable wood-based paper as a #7 mixed recyclable
VERSATILE: Prints on both sides through any laser printer or copy machine (does not print in inkjet printers). Works with pencil or all-weather pen

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars152 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
